Keep the character width and spacing from the PDF file. PDF files may have individual spacing and width for each character.

Which pages of the PDF document do you want to extract images from? If you want to recover all the images in the PDF document, choose 'All'.{n}{n}If you only want to extract images from specific pages in the PDF file, select 'Pages' and enter the page range in the 'From' and 'To' fields.

Which pages of the PDF document do you want to recover? If you want to recover the whole PDF file, choose 'All'.{n}{n}If you only want to recover specific pages in the PDF file, select 'Pages' and enter the page range in the 'From' and 'To' fields.

Usage: SolidConverterPDF.exe [/h] /i Input [/o Output] [/w argument] [/y | /n] [/c] [/s] [/a argument] [/f argument] [/p xxx[-yyy]] {n}{n}{t}/h {t}Displays this help. {n}{n}{t}/i {t}Specifies the file or files to be converted. {n}{n}{t}/o {t}Specifies the file name or directory for the new file(s). {n}{n}{t}/w {t}Silent mode (hide progress dialog is default). {n}{n}{t}{t} argument: + : Always show progress dialog (/w +). {n}{n}{t}{t} {t} x : Automatically close progress dialog if successful (/w x). {n}{n}{t}/y {t}Force overwriting of existing files (prompt to overwrite is default). {n}{n}{t}/n {t}Force converter to not overwrite exiting files (no conversion if output file exists). {n}{n}{t}/c {t}Don't detect columns (detect columns is default). {n}{n}{t}/f {t}Format options (the default is Flowing.){n}{t}{t}If this parameter exists, /c parameter is ignored. {n}{n}{t}{t} argument: tabl : Tables (/f tabl). {n}{n}{t}{t} {t} cont : Continuous (/f cont). {n}{n}{t}{t} {t} txt : Text (/f txt). {n}{n}{t}{t} {t} exact : Exact (/f exact). {n}{n}{t}/s {t}Ignore character spacing (keep character spacing is default). {n}{n}{t}/a {t}Image processing (the default is automatic). {n}{n}{t}{t} argument: g : page anchoring (/a g). {n}{n}{t}{t} {t} p : paragraph anchoring (/a p). {n}{n}{t}{t} {t} r : remove images (/a r). {n}{n}{t}/p {t}Page conversion (/p xxx-yyy): {n}{n}{t}{t} xxx : is starting page number and must be greater than 0. {n}{n}{t}{t} yyy : is ending page number and must be greater or equal to xxx.
[/h] /i Input [/o Output] [/w argument] [/y | /n] [/c argument]{n} [/f argument] [/s] [/a argument] [/p xxx[-yyy]{n}[/pwd ["password"]]]
[/h] /i Input [/o Output] [/w argument] [/y | /n] [/c argument]{n} [/f argument] [/s] [/p xxx[-yyy]]{n}[/pwd ["password"]]
Specifies the file or files to be converted.
Specifies the file name or directory for the new file(s).
Silent mode (hidden progress dialog is default).
+ : Always show progress dialog (/w +).{n}x : Automatically close progress dialog when successful (/w x).
Force overwriting of existing files (prompt to overwrite is default).
Force converter to not overwrite existing files (no conversion if output file exists).
tabl : Tables (/c tabl).{n}cont : Continuous (/c cont).{n}txt : Text (/c txt).{n}exact : Exact (/c exact).{n}x : Extract images only (/c x)
Ignore character spacing (keep character spacing is default).
Image placement mode (the default is automatic).
g : page anchoring (/a g).{n}p : paragraph anchoring (/a p).{n}r : remove images (/a r).
xxx : is start page number and must be greater than 0.{n}yyy : is end page number and must be greater or equal to xxx.
Header and footer processing (the default is detect).
r : detect and remove (/d r){n}i : ignore and process as content text (/d r)
Target format (default is defined in Program options)
rtf : Rich Text format (/f rtf){n}doc : Microsoft Word format (/f doc){n}wordml: Microsoft Word XML format
s : Install in system (/e s){n}e : embed in output document {n} (only for Microsoft Word target format (/e e)
Password option (default is to skip encrypted files)

missed argument : prompt for password for each encrypted file{n}"password" : quoted string. Use this password if the file is encrypted. {n}A file can be encrypted with an empty password - in this case just use double quotes("")
Select the warnings you want to display during conversion.
Show this warning at conversion time if the file contains vector graphics that are not yet supported. Vector graphic entities will be skipped.
This PDF file contains vector graphics that are not yet supported and thus were not converted.
Show this warning if there is no text in the converted file. The most likely reason is that it is a scanned document which consists entirely of bitmap image pages.
This file contains no text. The most likely reason is that it is a scanned document which consists entirely of bitmap image pages.

Show this warning if there is a page with completely hidden text (covered with bitmaps) in the converted file. The most likely reason is that it is a scanned document which consists entirely of bitmap image pages and machine-recognized text covered with this image.
This document consists of bitmap images text that has been completely covered by those images. Extracted text will appear behind the bitmap images that covered the original machine-recognized text.
Show this warning if the converted file contains non-standard encoding such as symbol fonts.
This file contains non-standard encoding and may be processed incorrectly.
Show this warning if the version of the Microsoft Office currently installed is less than Office XP.
Your copy of Microsoft Office is older than Office XP. The file can be converted, but you will not be able to open it on this computer.
Depending on the type of document and the purpose of the conversion, the document reconstruction mode provides great flexibility over layout, formatting and text flow recovery.
Flowing - recover page layout, columns, formatting, graphics and preserve text flow.
Tables - recover page layout, formatting, graphics and preserve text flow but ignore columns.
Continuous - detect layout and columns but only recover formatting, graphics and text flow.
Plain Text - detect layout and columns but only recover text flow without formatting.
Exact - recover exact page presentation using text boxes in Microsoft Word.
Convert document from PDF to Word
Select Remove Images to remove specific images from the document. You can also select Automatic Anchoring to convert all images to inline anchoring, Anchor to Paragraph, or Anchor to Page.
When layout is not preserved, only inline images can be recovered.{n}This option allows you to also remove the inline images.
When layout is preserved, inline images are always recovered.{n}This option allows you to remove or anchor images that are not inline.
Embedded fonts may be transferred to .doc files. You can choose to transfer all TrueType fonts, only the fonts with non-standard encoding, or none.
Embed TrueType fonts with non-standard encoding
TrueType and Type 1 fonts that are embedded in the PDF file may be optionally installed on your computer.
{applicationname} can recover or remove headers and footers.
Image Extraction is another feature of {applicationname} in addition to document conversion. Selectively configure specific features for image extraction.
When extracting images from a PDF document, you can choose to store them in a format other than the original.
When extracting images from a PDF document, you can choose to store them in a color depth other than the original.
Choose the reconstruction mode that is most appropriate for this PDF file:

When page layout is preserved, you have the choice of keeping the exact custom character spacing and widths from the PDF file. This is ideal for preserving exact page layout but not for making significant subsequent edits to the text.
Table detection applies when page layout is recognized using flowing or continuous reconstruction mode. This option is ideal for text documents but not for brochures.
Choose the output file format. Note that unformatted text (.txt) is not supported for complex formatting and page layout modes.
Microsoft Word binary .doc format (embedded font functionality supported)
{n}Choose where you want the destination file to be saved and whether you want to open the document in Microsoft Word after conversion.
Open document for editing after conversion.

PDF files may include fonts that are not on your computer. You may choose to selectively embed these fonts in the converted document if you have chosen Microsoft Word's binary .doc format on the previous screen of the Wizard.{n}{n}Embedding fonts will add to the size of the converted document.

{n}Often fonts which are not standard Windows fonts are embedded in PDF documents. You can choose to install any such fonts from your PDF file on your local machine as an alternate to embedding them in the converted document.
{applicationname} can recover or remove headers and footers. Page layout must be preserved for the recover option to be available.
Your conversion choices are shown below. Use the Previous button to make changes.{n}Press Finish to convert.
Only show this last screen in future. It is easy to reverse this choice.
Your conversion settings are shown below. Use the Activate Wizard button if you wish to make changes, or simply press the Convert button (<enter>) to proceed.

Selectively configure specific PDF creation features.
Embed all fonts in the PDF file.
Configure the PDF file security restrictions.
Encryption defaults to the most secure option: 128 bits RC4
Setting a User Password (also known as 'Document Open password') prevents users from opening the file unless they enter the password. For restricting printing and editing use an Owner Password.
Require user password to open the document
These permissions restrict the ways in which users can use the PDF file.

If you set any security restrictions in your PDF file you should also specify an Owner Password (also known as 'Permissions password'). Either User or Owner Password can be used for opening the PDF file.
Use owner password to restrict printing, editing and extraction
Select Yes to allow all users to print the PDF file, or No to permit printing for only those who know the Owner Password.
Select Yes to allow all users to change the content of the PDF file, or No to permit changing for only those who know the Owner Password.
Select Yes to allow all users to copy or extract content from the PDF file, or No to permit copying and extracting for only those who know the Owner Password.
Allow adding or editing of comments
Select Yes to allow all users to edit or add comments and form fields to the PDF file, or No to permit edits for only those who know the Owner Password.
Use {applicationname} to convert this document and open in Microsoft Word
